Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a fish in its natural water habitat.
The student can label the different parts of the fish's habitat, such as water, plants, and rocks.
The student can illustrate how the fish uses water to swim.
The student can show other plants or animals that live in the same habitat and label them.
The student can connect the fish's habitat to the resources it needs, like water and air.
The student can describe through drawing how the fish and its environment work together as a system.
